department_name: Department of Agricultural & Bio systems Engineering

courses.name: Bachelor of Science in Agricultural Engineering
courses.description: This program focuses on engineering principles applied to agricultural production, processing, and management of natural resources.

course_units.title: Introduction to Agricultural Engineering
course_units.description: Overview of agricultural engineering principles and applications.

course_units.title: Engineering Mathematics I
course_units.description: Mathematical concepts and methods for engineering applications.

course_units.title: Engineering Physics
course_units.description: Basic physics principles relevant to agricultural engineering.

course_units.title: Engineering Drawing
course_units.description: Principles and techniques of engineering drawing and design.

course_units.title: Engineering Mathematics II
course_units.description: Advanced mathematical methods for engineering applications.

course_units.title: Materials Science
course_units.description: Properties and behavior of engineering materials.

course_units.title: Soil Mechanics
course_units.description: Engineering properties of soils and soil behavior.

course_units.title: Thermodynamics
course_units.description: Principles of energy, heat transfer, and thermodynamic systems.

course_units.title: Fluid Mechanics
course_units.description: Behavior of fluids at rest and in motion.

course_units.title: Agricultural Machinery
course_units.description: Design and operation of agricultural machinery and equipment.

course_units.title: Irrigation and Drainage Engineering
course_units.description: Design and management of irrigation and drainage systems.

course_units.title: Structural Analysis
course_units.description: Analysis of agricultural structures and building components.

course_units.title: Power Systems in Agriculture
course_units.description: Power sources and transmission systems in agricultural operations.

course_units.title: Post-Harvest Engineering
course_units.description: Engineering aspects of post-harvest handling and processing.

course_units.title: Soil and Water Conservation Engineering
course_units.description: Engineering measures for soil and water conservation.

course_units.title: Food Process Engineering
course_units.description: Engineering principles applied to food processing operations.

course_units.title: Renewable Energy Systems
course_units.description: Engineering of renewable energy systems for agriculture.

course_units.title: Instrumentation and Control
course_units.description: Measurement and control systems in agricultural engineering.

course_units.title: Engineering Design Project I
course_units.description: First part of a comprehensive engineering design project.

course_units.title: Environmental Engineering
course_units.description: Engineering approaches to environmental issues in agriculture.

course_units.title: GIS Applications in Agricultural Engineering
course_units.description: Application of geographic information systems in agricultural engineering.

course_units.title: Engineering Design Project II
course_units.description: Continuation and completion of the engineering design project.

course_units.title: Agricultural Engineering Economics
course_units.description: Economic aspects of agricultural engineering projects and systems.

course_units.title: Professional Practice in Engineering
course_units.description: Professional and ethical aspects of engineering practice.
